channel.title: Lg optimus v Boot Loop
channel.description:
Ok my phone is stuck in boot loop, and most guides say to use the Lg mobile support tool, but the phone needs to be on to do that. And also, other guides say to hold down Home+Volume up+Power... But my phone wont stay on long enough to do this...
Side note: Phone turns on for about 2 seconds then turns off... Then repeats.
Any fixes?

item.title: Lg optimus v Boot Loop
item.dc:creator: @Mitko Mitko
item.description:
@Mitko wrote:

I think you can find expert help at http://xda-developers.com/ forums.

You can try looking for a guide on how to flash stock ROM, for my phone I use a PC tool called Odin.

EDIT: http://forum.xda-developers.com/forumdisplay.php?f=836

Read full topic

item.title: Lg optimus v Boot Loop
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

My phone goes straight into recovery after 3 seconds holding the buttons necessary. If the warranty isn’t up on your phone just try to get a new one. If not, just get a new phone at this point.

Read full topic

item.title: Lg optimus v Boot Loop
item.dc:creator: @Scyth1 Scyth_
item.description:
@Scyth1 wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:7, topic:452728”][quote author=Scyth_ link=topic=555604.msg4067731#msg4067731 date=1344050295]

Boot it into recovery mode. Did you hold volume up + power + home while it booted (home + volume up before pressing and holding power)?

I said in original post that i cant do that… duhhh…
[/quote]Your original post made it sound like you failed at making it enter recovery mode. I’m not even sure how it could be stuck in a boot loop when it supposedly can’t stay on for two seconds. Only fixes I can think of are rooting the phone and installing something such as Cyanogenmod, that could fix it (granted you can enter recovery mode, which I’m assuming you can’t do for whatever reason).[/quote]

I have no control over the the what so ever… And for the button combos, you needmthe phone to be on for like 10 seconds, but it doesnt stay on long enough

Read full topic

item.title: Lg optimus v Boot Loop
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Scyth_, post:5, topic:452728”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=555604.msg4067658#msg4067658 date=1344043671]
Boot it into recovery mode. Did you hold volume up + power + home while it booted (home + volume up before pressing and holding power)?
[/quote]

I said in original post that i cant do that… duhhh…[/quote]Your original post made it sound like you failed at making it enter recovery mode. I’m not even sure how it could be stuck in a boot loop when it supposedly can’t stay on for two seconds. Only fixes I can think of are rooting the phone and installing something such as Cyanogenmod, that could fix it (granted you can enter recovery mode, which I’m assuming you can’t do for whatever reason).

Read full topic

item.title: Lg optimus v Boot Loop
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Do you even get to recovery mode at all, even for them 2 seconds? If you can’t even get to that you’re pretty much screwed, I assume your warranty is up?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Scyth1 Scyth_
item.description:
@Scyth1 wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:2, topic:452728”]Bang it against the wall and hope it doesn’t get into worse shape!

But no seriously you already listed the only way I knew of sorry

edit: Did you drop it/get it wet sometime in the past six months?[/quote]

No
